document.title: TEXAS ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS FOR PHYSICAL EDUCATION

EA9FE203404F40C689B3643B40751FEF.description: identify and select physical activities for personal enjoyment.

FB4A9E85DE0C483EBBBBC4A83D4B63CC.description: participate in moderate to vigorous physical activity on a regular basis; and

8685910F1F604DFAB9EFD3A5643D11FF.description: Lifetime wellness--application of lifetime wellness. The physically literate student identifies the value of lifetime wellness. The student is expected to:

C70766A1F26E4F88ADC7FFDD56B6E9A9.description: Social and emotional health--accepting and providing constructive feedback. The physically literate student accepts and provides constructive feedback. The student is expected to listen respectfully and respond appropriately to specific corrective feedback with teacher guidance.

8CA0A0862CEF4E90BC31EC511113725E.description: Social and emotional health--perseverance. The physically literate student perseveres while addressing challenges. The student is expected to explain how practicing challenging physical activities can build confidence and minimize frustration when learning skills.

D36D012757034005873A7F08C02BBBF4.description: communicate feelings and thoughts appropriately without cue.

84CE4381F4614F1A8F165C8F9BF8EEE2.description: identify the causes of problems and propose solutions with teacher guidance; and

36FA4273538E4BF5AAEF898A7E75532F.description: Social and emotional health--resolving conflict and social interaction. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in resolving conflict and social interaction. The student is expected to:

BDC27A3F98304465AAE19E7F5BF3ABE2.description: identify self-management skills to control personal impulses and emotions.

570A874CCB5646CC8BF71EE347AF504E.description: explain and demonstrate respect for differences and similarities in abilities of self and others; and

6F5C466D1CA145E68393A3DB565A110C.description: differentiate between the positive and negative consequences of personal actions;

3ECFC31436BA44FCA666E014F2DC5725.description: Social and emotional health--personal responsibility and self-management. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in personal responsibility. The student is expected to:

29B1D261B6CC40339084A08DF4D29D6B.description: identify and explain safety precautions, including pedestrian, water, sun, cycling, and skating safety.

8538FF7BDA4D489A9D349EFE03FF727D.description: explain how proper attire and safety equipment promote safe participation and prevent injury in a variety of physical activities; and

2CAFA8F2FD0C4ECE8FA0E8DC88DE895C.description: Health, physical activity, and fitness--environmental awareness and safety practices. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in environmental awareness and understands safety practices. The student is expected to:

61AF6A1364104AC08FF70934F112389A.description: explain the need for proper hydration to enhance physical activity.

71847E2FC0D842AF9A36F36B9226BE5D.description: identify the types of food that produce energy to enhance physical activity; and

A51A450121CE40DBB394F103E0C47896.description: Health, physical activity, and fitness--nutrition and hydration. The physically literate student recognizes the correlation between nutrition, hydration, and physical activity. The student is expected to:

0C56D185E2D6424090E5DFAB33E58B33.description: identify how to measure improvement and track progress in physical skills with a measuring tool.

9C743D44BD7248B2A229847DE2742CE9.description: develop health-and skill-related goals with teacher guidance; and

CA216CCBA394406786CCEFE81150D3D0.description: Health, physical activity, and fitness--analyze data. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in the ability to analyze data used during fitness performance. The student is expected to:

41AB8B4136F644018F63B4BE372E64DE.description: demonstrate correct technique of exercises that promote health-related fitness.

DE3F62382D494947A6523C335E926EDA.description: define frequency and endurance as it relates to physical activities; and

1519342580E141F39BAB41DBBF352D38.description: list the benefits of regular physical activity on the heart and lungs;

7167C50FF6C241409EE3688A31C557F9.description: Health, physical activity, and fitness--fitness principles. The physically literate student demonstrates and recognizes a health-enhancing, physically active lifestyle. The student is expected to:

4F8DEAED4EB645B1905F02AF5C31ED7A.description: Performance strategies--outdoor and recreational pursuits. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in outdoor and recreational pursuits. The student is expected to describe outdoor recreation and health and fitness activities in school and the community.

68BE7DAD09694236B47270567FA87A21.description: demonstrate safe practices by using equipment appropriately and respecting personal space with minimal teacher guidance.

C59AD953B86D4A52B6C78162538886A3.description: participate in appropriate drills and activities to enhance the learning of specific motor development skills; and

68C7E1AD1ACF42AAAC2B9DE3C301C62A.description: apply the skills of chasing, fleeing, and dodging to avoid or catch others during a variety of games at low, middle, and high levels with appropriate speed and direction;

2893D0D80D944897B97FF9D9E5027BB0.description: Performance strategies--games and activities. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in performance strategies in invasion, target, net or wall, fielding, striking, and cooperative games. The student is expected to:

05710D635E5543819CF6CAE03DE7B429.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--rhythmic activities. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in rhythmic activities and rhythmic combinations. The student is expected to demonstrate simple rhythmic sequences using various locomotor and coordination skills in eight counts.

2760FF3076BA41809304C2D798227916.description: combine speed and direction as directed by the teacher.

7EF9336FB77E4D4D87DAD2042A015AAF.description: combine pathways, shapes, and levels into simple sequences; and

9E788E4C22E047C0B3F188EC2AD26AA1.description: demonstrate locomotor, non-locomotor, and manipulative skills safely in personal and general space;

DA57E19B817848ADA2757CAB825473E8.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--spatial and body awareness. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in spatial and body awareness, including pathways, shapes, levels, speed, direction, and force. The student is expected to:

DAED5958043E457E964B681EB911F000.description: demonstrate turning and jumping a long rope.

654B6BF6CC024D59B40E1EDAAF12042E.description: jump forward and backward with a self-turned rope; and

72A2D60D9C4A47A499AAE0ABE38A67D7.description: strike a stationary object off the ground or an elevated surface with a hand or short- or long-handled implement consecutively;

B6034A8CBEE94828818FBE1D9C452027.description: volley a lightweight object with consecutive hits to self or partner;

A06998D03A1F42309F7ABC1238882C7F.description: kick a moving ball using a continuous running approach;

C4CA1357A617418E82F0A1080F2E92CC.description: dribble a ball with control using both feet while walking;

17A1DE87FD93418F9D1FF60475C086A1.description: demonstrate key elements of hand dribbling while walking;

C224195C4D974EEFBD3AF5213D506513.description: demonstrate key elements when catching an accurately and softly thrown large ball without trapping against the body;

7A6D0E0E87A94729ADFD07FADD430210.description: demonstrate key elements in underhand throwing to a partner and overhand throwing to a target with opposite foot forward;

E3394DF8C4994E87B34E6A3BDB6E92EA.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--manipulative skills. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in developmentally appropriate manipulative skills. The student is expected to:

1766FF80A4D849F8A4233EEC42E4A23F.description: differentiate between bending, stretching, twisting, curling, pushing, pulling, and swaying.

5AE46BCFC4DA44319EEA0C9772EF392D.description: demonstrate maintaining balance standing on one foot while placing the free leg in a variety of different positions for eight seconds; and

2CE975698385482091C0BC1F5BF882DB.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--non-locomotor skills. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in fundamental movement patterns and developmentally appropriate skills. The student is expected to:

D0248D3650B84E23B3E171E089D2E38B.description: spin and roll at different levels, speeds, and positions.

D3E54D662364430781A37ECF3E88112F.description: demonstrate basic balancing, cross lateralization, and sequencing of three skills with repetition; and

1EA62BDBF53C4A1288C7A0A56993B8EF.description: demonstrate correct jumping and landing technique while consecutively jumping in place, forward and backward, side to side, half turns, and in tuck position;

06864424581F40BEA78ACBA0EC8303E6.description: practice and apply correct technique while hopping, galloping, running, sliding, and skipping;

45240C29D81843A6808A8E5B89C760A8.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--locomotor skills. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in fundamental movement patterns and developmentally appropriate skills. The student is expected to:
